intro: Scopolia mariae, commonly known as the Mary's scopolia, is a flowering plant belonging to the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its fragrant, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant produces showy, violet-blue berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in well-drained, moist soil and prefers partial to full shade. Scopolia mariae is valued in horticulture for its ornamental beauty and historical use in traditional medicine.
